intro: Epitriche cuspidata, commonly known as the spiked epitype, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Epitriche cuspidata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
